text: Thank you so much guys! You're the best!
Ok
How can I use the code in my {% require js%} to set the text of an element in my module?? I cant seem to get it working
What's the code you're using right now for this?
Let me get a screenshot
Im able to log out all my info but i cant set it to my <p> element :')))
im new to this so bear with me if this looks horrendous lol

You can try wrapping everything in a:
`document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {`
`//your code here`
`})`
do you have any error in the console?
in my require JS portion?
nope no errors
addevent listener no bueno :cry:
does the requireJS have to have my <p> wrapped inside it?
have you tried adding something like "has-submenu" or similar to it?
I GOT IT
`document.getElementById("banner-text").innerHTML = `${Difference_In_Days} {{ module.banner_text }}`;` idk why this worked
but i just targeted the ID directly

By taking a look at the screenshot it looks like the p tag is not closed, so what I'll do is this (i'll simplify the code so you can try this and then implement the rest of your code)

`<p class="js-paragraph"></p>`

`{% require_js position="footer" %}`
`<script>`
`document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {`
`const paragraph = document.querySelector(".js-paragraph");`

`paragraph.innerHTML = "test"`
`})`
`</script>`
`{% end_require_js %}`
Ah... got it. if link.children. Thank you!

Can anyone comment on whether it's possible to build a module for email that will allow html stored in an object property to be added to the email via a personalization token? The HTML modules don't allow HubL and the text modules won't take in HTML via a token.

Ideas?

The issue I keep running into is that when I create a multi-language dynamic page, as soon as I click a different language in the language switcher it takes me back to the root URL of the page.  Love your help. It feels like I'm missing something simple.
